title: Champion Portrait (at the bottom left corner of the game)
body:
Why can't Riot make the face portrait according to the skin? I'm sure it's not that card to crop out a basic square from every skin, won't take more than an hour...if Riot told me to do it I would happily do all of them :P

It would look so much better, especially when you're using a skin which is much better than the classic splash art.....


But, what I really wanna know is why not?? I can't think of any reason why not to...

{{champion:38}} {{item:3003}}

replies.body: Because they won't get any money for it.
The portrait DOES change but only with ultimate skins, so thats why they haven't changed it for other skins so that they have an extra point of sale for the ultimates.

Apparently to not cause any confusion about who the player is playing.

Which is kinda stupid because SGU and PFE (ultimate skins) have their skin portraits in the bottom left corner.

Money = "Clarity"

> [{quoted}](name=Rav,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=zevtmWkf,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2014-12-15T10:16:29.698+0000)
> Apparently to not cause any confusion about who the player is playing.
> 
> Which is kinda stupid because SGU and PFE (ultimate skins) have their skin portraits in the bottom left corner.
> 
> Money = "Clarity"

wot >_> "clarity"

I'm assuming that most players would actually prefer their skin portrait, I mean, I may be wrong but I definitely would prefer it

I'd honestly prefer it too, except most of the skin arts are low resolution and would look slightly blurry (the 2 ultimate skins have a different picture, not just a zoomed in splash art) but that is besides the point. Riot thinks that having this will  (again) reduce "clarity". 

Don't know how to put this into simpler terms, Riot thinks it will cause confusion such as when people are streaming and the viewer doesn't know what champion the streamer is playing because of the varying skins etc.
